debut.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the first public appearance of an entertainer, sports player etc or of something new and important
debut.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: His Broadway debut was ‘The Scarlet Pimpernel’.
Their debut album was recorded in 1991.
He scored in his debut match for the club.
He made his Major League debut as shortstop.
debut.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to appear in public or become available for the first time
debut.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The show will debut next Monday at 8.00 pm.
debut.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to introduce a product to the public for the first time
debut.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Ralph Lauren debuted his autumn collection in Paris last week.
debut.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the first public appearance of a product or service, or the first time that it is available to buy
debut.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The new machines will mark the debut of the next generation of memory chips.
debut.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: an occasion when a company ISSUEs (=makes available and sells) shares, bonds etc for the first time
debut.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Bangkok Land made a notable debut, accounting for about 32% of the exchange’s total trading volume.
